channel.title: Giancarlo Buomprisco - Articles
channel.description: Learn how to build Serverless applications with web technologies such as React, Next.js, Angular, NestJS and Firebase

item.title: Lazy Rendering React components with the Intersection Observer API
item.description: In this post, we are going to build a React component to lazy rendering React trees to improve performance and page loading speed.

item.title: A React Component to connect with MetaMask
item.description: In this post, we are going to build a React button able to connect with a Metamask Wallet, and read the wallet's selected address.

item.title: Announcing MakerKit - A SaaS starter for Next.js and Firebase
item.description: MakerKit is a SaaS starter for Next.js, Firebase, and Tailwind CSS. It comes with authentication, organizations, payments with Stripe, a blog and documentation generators, and much more.

item.title: A Scalable Project Structure for Next.js
item.description: Next.js and React are not opinionated. Much is left to us to figure out - and without rules, our code can get wild pretty quickly. In this post I explain the rationale behind the way I structure my Next.js projects for small and medium-sized apps

item.title: Generating automatic banners for your Blog
item.description: Say no to custom banners. This post will teach you how to generate automatic banners for your articles using Next.js, SVG and Sharp

item.title: A Reactive Enum with Typescript and RxJs
item.description: Typescript's template literals' types allow us to generate dynamic and typed code, together. In this article, I want to show how we can build a dynamic reactive enum with TS and RxJS

item.title: Caching RxJS streams into Web Storage
item.description: In this article I will introduce you to a simple utility that allows you to cache RxJS streams in memory or the browser's storage

item.title: An Overview
item.description: Firebase is Gooogle's PaaS, geared towards mobile apps but perfect for any kind of application. This post is a brief introduction to Firebase: what it is, what you can use it for, and how to get started

item.title: Benchmarking Angular 12 with Webpack 5
item.description: Angular 12 has been released and with it the much awaited Webpack 5 upgrade. In this post I benchmarked the bundle-size and compilation speed against the previous version
